title: Differential Equation: Cylindrical Coffee Pot part - c

content.description: A coffeepot has the shape of a cylinder with radius 5 inches, as shown in the figure above. Let h be the depth of the coffee in the pot, measured in inches, where h is a function of time t, measured in seconds. The volume V of coffee in the pot is changing at the rate of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mi>π</mi> <msqrt> <mi>h</mi> </msqrt> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DAC@</annotation> </semantics> </math> cubic inches per second. (The volume V of a cylinder with radius r and height h is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>V</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>π</mi> <msup> <mi>r</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>h</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FB0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.)
content.question: At what time t is the coffeepot empty?

frqParts.text: At what time t is the coffeepot empty?

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
